result.execSummary:
The defendant Daniel J Poteat #556764 was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: Columbia County 16CF04, but consecutive to sentence presently serving.

superMiscConds.notes: No use or possession of alcohol, illicit drugs or drug paraphernalia.  Participate in & complete AODA treatment and Cognitive Behavioral Therapy.  No contact with Emily Malkowski, Dylan Farber, and Jesse Farber.  Maintain full time employment, education or combination of both.  Comply with risk & needs assessments & any other screening tools identified by the DOC.  Comply with case plan goals related to identified criminogenic needs & follow through with any programming recommended by the DOC.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: Columbia County Case 16CF04, but consecutive to sentence currently serving.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Filed by Atty Ron Benavides.

Defendant Daniel J Poteat  #556764 in court, in custody with attorney Ronald Gabriel Benavides.  Crystal N Long appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Cases called: 16CF04 and 15CF156.  Sentencing recommendations were argued.  Defendant made a statement to the court on his behalf.  Court sentenced defendant on both cases to serve 4 years in prison.  2 years initial confinement each case.  2 years extended supervision each case.  This will be concurrent to each other, but consecutive to sentence he is currently serving.  All conditions listed on page 24 of PSI are to be a part of extended supervision.  Stipulation is to be filed for credit due.  Defendant is eligible for Challenge program and for the Substance Abuse program.   9:47/10:31

Sentencing hearing on December 16, 2016 at 09:30 am.
Filed by Atty Ron Benavides.

16CF4, 16CF5, 15CF156 & 15CF159, Defendant Daniel J Poteat  #556764 in court, in custody with attorney Ronald Gabriel Benavides.  Crystal N Long appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court went over the rights & elements. Defendant pled no contest to count 2 in 15CF156 and count 4 in 16CF4. Court found defendant guilty, entered judgment. 15CF159, 16CF5 and remaining counts in 16CF4 read in and dismissed. Court PSI to be completed. Argued sentencing to be scheduled after PSI filed. Bonds continued.
